_header: O hateful harm condition of poverty
Note: A translation of part of Pope Innocent III’s De miseria condicionis humane.
Title(s): Man of Law’s Prologe; Canterbury Tales
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Man of Law’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 35 lines (five stanzas) in rhyme royal.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
O hateful harme condicion of pouertwith thrust with coolde with
                    hungre so confoundid…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…ner that a marchaunt gon is many a yereme taughte a tale
                    which th ye shul here
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…and next folwyng bigynneth his tale (f. 142v); the man of
                    lawe (RT)

BodBar20.First Lines:
O hateful harm condicion of pouertwith thrist with cold with honger
                    so confounded…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Nere þat a marchant goon is mony a ȝereMe taght a
                    tale wich þat ȝe shal here
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…& here begynnyth þe tale (f. 64); The Man of law
                    (RT)

Bod686.Attributed Title:

BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:

PhilRos10841.First Lines:
A hatful harme condicion of pouertWith thurst with colde with
                    honger so confounded…
PhilRos10841.Last Lines:
…Nere that a marchaunt gon ys many a ȝeerMe taught a tale
                    whych as ȝe schul her
PhilRos10841.Note:
The MS is misbound, with [13].8 following [12].7 (becoming f. 43) and Q
                    [14] misbound to follow Q [12] (with [14] foliated 44-51, and [13] foliated
                    52-57). Quires [1-4] and [6-7] are inferred to be lost, with the foliation not
                    taking account of them. Thus V.9-91 follow II.558-1190 and are in turn followed
                    by II.79-557; a blank leaf follows, and then V.92, etc. V.656-72 lost; 134-40
                    omitted.
PhilRos10841.Attributed Title:
…And begynneth þe tale of þe man of lawe (f. 52); The Man
                    of lawe (RT)

PhilRos10842.Last Lines: …Me taght a tale wich that yee mowe here
PhilRos10842.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth the Man of lawe his tale / the wich is I Cronnyclyd (rubric,
                    f. 3)
